purpose: To outline actions for building an equitable and inclusive workplace.
title: Long term, take action now to build a more equitable and inclusive workplace to ensure a positive recovery for all

bullets.highlight: Develop measurable aspirations and leadership commitments
bullets.text: Be intentional about which diverse populations you will solve for first
Establish both internal and external aspirations
Set a DEI governance structure (e.g., task force)

bullets.highlight: Dig into your data to develop a focused plan
bullets.text: Identify your specific pain points – don’t solve for generic challenges
Beware of the risk of doing too much without a focused plan

bullets.highlight: Treat DEI success like all other business priorities

bullets.text: Align incentives and rewards to aspirations
Fund DEI programs like you would any other business imperative

reasoning_strategy: Highlight the importance of targeted actions and monitoring in DEI initiatives.
data_points: Only 50% of companies have a measurable aspiration
9 out of 10 employees globally say their companies should act externally
<55% of companies have a quantitative + qualitative diagnostic
Yet, the majority of companies are doing 15+ things
DEI falls to the penultimate priority when forced to rank against other business priorities

content_zones.left: Develop measurable aspirations and leadership commitments
content_zones.center: Dig into your data to develop a focused plan
content_zones.right: Treat DEI success like all other business priorities
